author: James Tanner
method: Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and gently fry the onion and garlic for 2-3 minutes, or until softened. Stir in the chopped tomato, vinegar and sugar and cook for a further 3-4 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved.  Using a stick blender, process the sauce until smooth, then stir in the cooked tagliatelle and heat through.  Transfer the pasta onto a serving plate and garnish with the chopped chives.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  ½ onion, finely chopped,  1 garlic clove, crushed to a paste in a mortar and pestle,  1 vine tomato, seeds removed and chopped,  2 tbsp white wine vinegar,  1 tsp caster sugar,  100g/3½oz dried tagliatelle, cooked according to packet instructions, drained,  2 tbsp chopped fresh chives, to garnish
